title: Relates to the sale of controlled substances to minors
summary: Increases penalties for the sale of controlled substances to minors: sale to persons under 18 years of age shall be an A-II felony and sale to a person under 14 years of age shall be an A-I felony.

       Introduced by M. of A. LAVINE -- read once and referred to the Committee

       AN  ACT  to  amend  the penal law, in relation to the sale of controlled
         substances to minors

         THE PEOPLE OF THE STATE OF NEW YORK, REPRESENTED IN SENATE AND  ASSEM-
       BLY, DO ENACT AS FOLLOWS:

    1    Section  1.  Subdivision  7  of  section  220.41  of the penal law, as
    2  amended by chapter 75 of the laws of 1995, is amended and a new subdivi-
    3  sion 8 is added to read as follows:
    4    7.  methadone and the methadone weighs three hundred sixty  milligrams
    5  or more[.]; OR
    6    8. A CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE TO A PERSON LESS THAN EIGHTEEN YEARS OF AGE.
    7    S  2.  Subdivision 2 of section 220.43 of the penal law, as amended by
    8  chapter 75 of the laws of 1995, is amended and a new  subdivision  3  is
    9  added to read as follows:
   10    2.  methadone  and  the  methadone  weighs  two thousand eight hundred
   11  eighty milligrams or more[.]; OR
   12    3. A CONTROLLED SUBSTANCE TO A PERSON LESS THAN FOURTEEN YEARS OF AGE.
   13    S 3. This act shall take effect September 1, 2011.





        EXPLANATION--Matter in ITALICS (underscored) is new; matter in brackets
                             [ ] is old law to be omitted.
